name: PedePizza
author: João Santos
texts: PedePizza is a modern and responsive website for ordering pizzas, built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and a Node.js REST API. It’s designed to offer a seamless and intuitive user experience across all devices.
Users can browse a menu of delicious pizzas, customize their orders, and add items to their cart. The website ensures a smooth process from selection to checkout, making it easy to place orders.
The backend, powered by Node.js and Express, handles order management and user interactions efficiently. Integration with MongoDB provides reliable data storage for user orders and preferences.
PedePizza combines functionality and design to create an engaging platform for pizza lovers, showcasing how web technologies can deliver both utility and enjoyment.

name: SmartWiki
author: João Santos
texts: SmartWiki is a responsive platform built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap, focused on delivering information about smart cities and showcasing smart home products. Its design ensures accessibility across all devices.

Users can explore articles and guides on various topics related to smart cities, learning about innovative technologies and sustainable urban solutions. The platform also features a store with a wide range of smart home products.
With an intuitive interface, SmartWiki allows users to browse, search, and interact effortlessly. Features like wishlists and direct purchasing make the shopping experience convenient and enjoyable.
SmartWiki combines education and commerce, providing a unique hub for those interested in smart city innovations and smart home technologies.

name: NodeCraft
author: João Santos
texts: NodeCraft is a powerful platform for managing Minecraft servers on Linux, featuring a Node.js API and a React-powered web interface. It simplifies server creation and management.
The intuitive web interface allows users to control server settings, monitor performance, and manage files seamlessly. The platform is designed for efficiency and ease of use.
With a focus on automation, NodeCraft streamlines the process of running and customizing Minecraft servers, making it accessible to all users.
This project demonstrates the integration of modern web technologies to create a robust and user-friendly server management solution.

name: Snake
author: João Santos
texts: WebSnake is a simple yet engaging Snake game built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. As a responsive website, it offers smooth gameplay across devices.
Players control the snake using arrow keys, collecting food to grow and increase their score. The game challenges users to avoid colliding with the snake's own body or the screen edges.
The intuitive design and real-time score tracking provide a fun and nostalgic gaming experience. WebSnake is a great demonstration of interactive web development.
This project showcases how basic web technologies can create an entertaining and functional browser-based game.

name: Culturafro
author: João Santos
texts: CulturaFro is a responsive website built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, dedicated to exploring African culture and its influence in Brazil. Its design ensures accessibility and engagement across all devices.
The platform provides insightful content about African traditions, history, and their contributions to Brazilian society, fostering education and cultural appreciation.
With a clean and user-friendly interface, CulturaFro offers an enriching experience for users to learn and connect with this vibrant cultural heritage.
This project highlights the power of web technologies to promote cultural awareness and celebrate diversity.

name: Phoenix
author: João Santos
texts: Phoenix is a responsive news website built with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Bootstrap, focusing on smart cities in Brazil. It delivers up-to-date information on innovation and urban development.
The platform covers topics like sustainability, technology, infrastructure, and security, aiming to inform and engage readers about advancements in smart city solutions.
With a modern design and intuitive navigation, Phoenix ensures a seamless experience for users across all devices, making it easy to explore articles and updates.
This project combines technology and journalism to raise awareness about the future of urban living in Brazil.
